model

Class DataAccess

  • Object
    • DataAccess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class DataAccess
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Provides a generic booking application with high-level methods to access its data store, where the booking information is persisted. The class also hides to the application the implementation of the data store (whether a Relational DBMS, XML files, Excel sheets, etc.) and the complex machinery required to access it (SQL statements, XQuery calls, specific API, etc.).

    The booking information includes:

    • A collection of seats (whether theater seats, plane seats, etc.) available for booking. Each seat is uniquely identified by a number in the range [1, seatCount]. For the sake of simplicity, there is no notion of row and column, as in a theater or a plane: seats are considered adjoining if they bear consecutive numbers.
    • A price list including various categories. For the sake of simplicity, (a) the price of a seat only depends on the customer, e.g. adult, child, retired, etc., not on the location of the seat as in a theater, (b) each price category is uniquely identified by an integer in the range [0, categoryCount), e.g. 0=adult, 1=child, 2=retired. (Strings or symbolic constants, like Java enums, are not used.)

    A typical booking scenario involves the following steps:

    1. The customer books one or more seats, specifying the number of seats requested in each price category with bookSeats(String, List, boolean). He/She lets the system select the seats to book from the currently-available seats.
    2. Alternatively, the customer can check the currently-available seats with getAvailableSeats(boolean) and then specify the number of the seats he/she wants to book in each price category with bookSeats(String, List).
    3. Later on, the customer can change his/her mind and cancel with cancelBookings(List) one or more of the bookings he/she previously made.
    4. At any time, the customer can check the bookings he/she currently has with getBookings(String).
    5. The customer can repeat the above steps any number of times.

    The constructor and the methods of this class all throw a DataAccessException when an unrecoverable error occurs, e.g. the connection to the data store is lost. The methods of this class never return null. If the return type of a method is List<Item> and there is no item to return, the method returns the empty list rather than null.

    Notes to implementors:

    1. Do not modify the interface of the classes in the model package. If you do so, the test programs will not compile. Also, remember that the exceptions that a method throws are part of the method's interface.
    2. The test programs will abort whenever a DataAccessException is thrown: make sure your code throws a DataAccessException only when a severe (i.e. unrecoverable) error occurs.
    3. JDBC often reports constraint violations by throwing an SQLException: if a constraint violation is intended, make sure your your code does not report it as a DataAccessException.
    4. The implementation of this class must withstand failures (whether client, network of server failures) as well as concurrent accesses to the data store through multiple DataAccess objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataAccess

        public DataAccess(String url,
                  String login,
                  String password)
           throws DataAccessException
        Creates a new DataAccess object that interacts with the specified data store, using the specified login and the specified password. Each object maintains a dedicated connection to the data store until the close method is called.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the data store to connect to
        login - the (application) login to use
        password - the password
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

    • Method Detail

      • initDataStore

        public boolean initDataStore(int seatCount,
                             List<Float> priceList)
                      throws DataAccessException
        Initializes the data store according to the specified number of seats and the specified price list. If the data store is already initialized or if it already contains bookings when this method is called, it is reset and initialized again from scratch. When the method completes, the state of the data store is as follows: all the seats are available for booking, no booking is made.

        Note to implementors:

        1. All the information provided by the parameters must be persisted in the data store. (It must not be kept in Java instance or class attributes.) To enforce this, the data store will be initialized by running the DataStoreInit program, and then tested by running the SingleUserTest and MultiUserTest programs.
        2. Do not use the statements drop database ... and create database ... in this method, as the test program might not have sufficient privileges to execute them. Use the statements drop table ... and create table ... instead.
        3. The schema of the database (in the sense of "set of tables") is left unspecified. You can select any schema that fulfills the requirements of the DataAccess methods.
        Parameters:
        seatCount - the total number of seats available for booking
        priceList - the price for each price category
        Returns:
        true if the data store was initialized successfully and false otherwise
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

      • getPriceList

        public List<Float> getPriceList()
                         throws DataAccessException
        Returns the price list.

        Note to implementors:
        The method must return the price list persisted in the data store.

        Returns:
        the price list
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

      • getAvailableSeats

        public List<Integer> getAvailableSeats(boolean stable)
                                throws DataAccessException
        Returns the available seats in the specified mode. Two modes are provided: stable or not. If the stable mode is selected, the returned seats are guaranteed to remain available until one of the bookSeats methods is called on this data access object. If the stable mode is not selected, the returned seats might have been booked by another user when one of these methods is called. Regardless of the mode, the available seats are returned in ascending order of number.

        Note to implementors:
        The stable mode is defined as an exercise. It cannot be used in a production application as this would prevent all other users from retrieving the available seats until the current user decides which seats to book.

        Parameters:
        stable - true to select the stable mode and false otherwise
        Returns:
        the available seats in ascending order or the empty list if no seat is available
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

      • bookSeats

        public List<Booking> bookSeats(String customer,
                               List<Integer> counts,
                               boolean adjoining)
                        throws DataAccessException
        Books the specified number of seats for the specified customer in the specified mode. The number of seats to book is specified for each price category. Two modes are provided: adjoining or not. If the adjoining mode is selected, the method guarantees that the booked seats are adjoining. If the adjoining mode is not selected, the returned seats might be apart. Regardless of the mode, the bookings are returned in ascending order of seat number.

        If the specified customer already has bookings, the adjoining mode only applies to the new bookings: The method will not try to select seats adjoining to already-booked seats by the same customer.

        The method executes in an all-or-nothing fashion: if there are not enough available seats left or if the seats are not adjoining while the adjoining mode is selected, then no seat is booked.

        Parameters:
        customer - the customer who makes the booking
        counts - the count of seats to book for each price category: counts.get(i) is the count of seats to book in category #i
        adjoining - true to select the adjoining mode and false otherwise
        Returns:
        the list of bookings if the booking was successful or the empty list otherwise
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

      • bookSeats

        public List<Booking> bookSeats(String customer,
                               List<List<Integer>> seatss)
                        throws DataAccessException
        Books the specified seats for the specified customer. The seats to book are specified for each price category.

        The method executes in an all-or-nothing fashion: if one of the specified seats cannot be booked because it is not available, then none of them is booked.

        Parameters:
        customer - the customer who makes the booking
        seatss - the list of seats to book in each price category: seatss.get(i) is the list of seats to book in category #i
        Returns:
        the list of the bookings made by this method call or the empty list if no booking was made
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

      • getBookings

        public List<Booking> getBookings(String customer)
                          throws DataAccessException
        Returns the current bookings of the specified customer. If no customer is specified, the method returns the current bookings of all the customers.
        Parameters:
        customer - the customer whose bookings must be returned or the empty string "" if all the bookings must be returned
        Returns:
        the list of the bookings of the specified customer or the empty list if the specified customer does not have any booking
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

      • cancelBookings

        public boolean cancelBookings(List<Booking> bookings)
                       throws DataAccessException
        Cancel the specified bookings. The method checks against the data store that each of the specified bookings is valid, i.e. it is assigned to the specified customer, for the specified price category.

        The method executes in an all-or-nothing fashion: if one of the specified bookings cannot be canceled because it is not valid, then none of them is canceled.

        Parameters:
        bookings - the bookings to cancel
        Returns:
        true if all the bookings were canceled and false otherwise
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs

      • close

        public void close()
           throws DataAccessException
        Closes this data access object. This closes the underlying connection to the data store and releases all related resources. The application must call this method when it is done using this data access object.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if an unrecoverable error occurs
